verbs.description: acclimate (third-person singular simple present acclimates, present participle acclimating, simple past and past participle acclimated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, chiefly US) To habituate to a climate not native; to acclimatize.
(transitive, chiefly US) To adjust to a new environment; not necessarily a wild, natural, earthy one.
(intransitive, chiefly US) To become accustomed to a new climate or environment.
